meta.description:
- GP1SVCUI

Over 850 participants, from 45 Indigenous Peoples, are together since June 8th in the Stand Up For The Earth camp, in Brasília, demanding vaccines, food safety and respect to their rights, besides denouncing the Bolsonaro government antienvironmental agenda. With their rights at risk and demarcations in a standstill, Indigenous People fight against an "evil pack", full of ruralist (congresspeople associated with agribusiness) initiatives that aim on opening Indigenous Lands for economic exploitation.
On June 19th, various acts were held in all Brazilian capitals and several other cities, inside and outside the country.

title: Greenpeace - Indigenous People Manifest in Brasília, Brazil
